Class WorldMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • WorldMap

  • public class WorldMap
extends java.lang.Object
    Grid of the world with an array of each WorldMapSquare space in the grid
    Version:
    Apr 27, 2018
    Author:
    , Period: 4, Assignment: Adventure, Sources:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorldMap(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a grid with a width and height.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkMonster(int r, int c)
      Checks to see if the WorldMapSquare at a row and column contains a Monster.
      WorldMapSquare[][] getMap()
      Returns the map
      int getMapCols()
      Returns the number of columns in map
      int getMapRows()
      Returns the number of rows in map
      WorldMapSquare getSquare(int r, int c)
      Returns the WorldMap square at a row/col combination on the grid.
      void setSquareToRoad(int r, int c)
      Sets the WorldMapSquare at a row and column to a Square.HASHTAG with 0 danger on the visible and hidden map.
      void showAround(Player p)
      Reveals on the map what's around the player in the hidden map.
      void showAroundRandom()
      Randomly picks a location on the map that is still hidden to show around (by copying what's on the hidden map to the visible map).

    • Constructor Detail

      • WorldMap

        public WorldMap(int rows,
                int cols)
        Creates a grid with a width and height. Fills the map with spaces (from the Square enum) and the hidden map with locations and periods (from the Square enum).
        Parameters:
        width - width of grid
        height - height of grid

    • Method Detail

      • showAround

        public void showAround(Player p)
        Reveals on the map what's around the player in the hidden map. Uses the player's location to show around.
        Parameters:
        p - the player to reveal squares around

      • showAroundRandom

        public void showAroundRandom()
        Randomly picks a location on the map that is still hidden to show around (by copying what's on the hidden map to the visible map).

      • getMap

        public WorldMapSquare[][] getMap()
        Returns the map
        Returns:
        the grid of WorldMap

      • getMapRows

        public int getMapRows()
        Returns the number of rows in map
        Returns:
        number of rows in map

      • getMapCols

        public int getMapCols()
        Returns the number of columns in map
        Returns:
        number of columns in map, null if the coordinates are not valid

      • getSquare

        public WorldMapSquare getSquare(int r,
                                int c)
        Returns the WorldMap square at a row/col combination on the grid.
        Parameters:
        r - the row of the square (from 0)
        c - the column of the square (from 0)
        Returns:
        the WorldMapSquare at the row/col location, or null if the location isn't valid.

      • checkMonster

        public boolean checkMonster(int r,
                            int c)
        Checks to see if the WorldMapSquare at a row and column contains a Monster.
        Parameters:
        r - the row of the square (from 0)
        c - the column of the square (from 0)
        Returns:
        true if the square at row/column has a monster. false if there's no Monster or if the row/column isn't valid.

      • setSquareToRoad

        public void setSquareToRoad(int r,
                            int c)
        Sets the WorldMapSquare at a row and column to a Square.HASHTAG with 0 danger on the visible and hidden map.
        Parameters:
        r - the row of the square (from 0)
        c - the column of the square (from 0)
